meals.title: Pierogies
meals.directions:
1. Boil pierogies until they float (salted water).
2. Caramelize some onions.
3. Put into frying pan with butter.
4. Take out of pan and put onto plate when golden-brown.
5. Top with cheese, bacon bits, caramelized onions, and chives - sour cream on the side.
6. Optional: add Frank's hot sauce for some spice.

meals.title: Burger
meals.directions:
1. Put a patty on the grill - 6 minutes on medium heat with the grill open.
2. Caramelize some onions.
3. Fry some bacon.
4. Put some mayo on the top bun, and two pickle slices on the bottom bun.
5. Flip the burger after 6 minutes, place a slice of cheese (Monterey Jack is recommended, cheddar is the next best) on the top of the patty. Leave on for 6 more minutes.
6. After 6 minutes, take the burger off the grill, and place (cheese side down) onto the bottom bun (the one with pickles).
7. Add ketchup, mustard, Frank's, and seasoning (A&W burger seasoning is best, Club House's Montreal Steak Spice is a close second), bacon,  tomato, lettuce, and onions.
8. Eat.

meals.title: Hot Dogs
meals.directions:
1. Put hot dogs on the grill at medium heat with the grill open
2. Rotate every few minutes for 10 minutes, take off the grill.
3. Line the buns with some chips and some cheese slices (cheddar is best).
4. Put the hot dogs in the buns, add ketchup, mustard, and Frank's.

meals.title: Scrambled Eggs & Toast
meals.directions:
1. Mix eggs and a slash of milk into a container.
2. Once mixed, pour into hot pan (with butter).
3. Mix around and prevent from burning until mostly cooked.
4. Once mostly cooked, add some sharp cheddar (imperial cheese).
5. Put the cinnamon raisin bread into the toaster.
6. Keep mixing until all cooked (once they're no longer wet).
7. Plate with buttered toast, salt and pepper.

meals.title: Sausages
meals.directions:
1. Grill two sausages on medium heat with the grill open.
2. Rotate every few minutes.
3. Plate with Dijon mustard.

meals.title: Caesar Salad
meals.directions:
1. Wash the lettuce.
2. Chop up the lettuce, put into large bowl.
3. Add dressing.

meals.title: Granola
meals.directions:
1. Pour granola into bowl.
2. Add milk.
3. Add unfrozen berries.

meals.title: Ramen
meals.description: The easiest type of meal to cook.
meals.directions:
1. Add ramen into bowl.
2. Add hot water into bowl.
3. Wait.
4. Drain excess hot water (until water is level with noodles).
5. Add broth powder.
6. Consume.

meals.title: Divorced Chicken
meals.directions:
1. Microwave divorced chicken.
2. Tear apart and put pulled chicken onto plate.
3. Apply Frank's liberally.
4. Salt & pepper.

meals.title: Wings
meals.directions:
1. Put wings in a large Ziploc.
2. Add Frank's to the Ziploc (make the wings swim).
3. Put in fridge overnight.
4. Take out of bag and put straight onto the grill.
5. Flip after a few minutes.
6. Take off the grill and onto plate.
7. Add more Frank's onto individual wings before consumption.

meals.title: Black Bean Burritos
meals.directions:
1. Thoroughly rinse the beans under cool, running water.  Set aside to drain.
2. Meanwhile, chop the red pepper and red onion (finely for the onion - big chunks of onion are nasty!)
3. Chop half a bunch of cilantro, if using.
4. Mix beans, onions, red peppers, cilantro and protein (if you're adding it).
5. Squeeze a lime into the mix, a tsp of olive oil, add a pinch of salt and chili to your taste. Start with just a bit (half a tsp if you are using the chipotle stuff. Trust me, it’s hot).
6. Get your wrap ready with sour cream and spinach or lettuce, add black bean salsa mixture, add salsa, guacamole.
7. Enjoy!

**NOTE**: You can also add left over rice to this mixture for extra “oomph”. It will fill you up and stretch the recipe a bit further (more days without cooking!)

**Extra:** Add left over black bean salsa to nachos or on top of lettuce with extra salsa as a salad. You can wrap it in wraps and coat with enchilada sauce (the fiesta stuff in a small bag) and cover with cheese for enchiladas. If you do this, just pour some enchilada mixture in the pan to coat the bottom BEFORE adding the wraps to the dish. Pour remaining sauce on top, add cheese and bake at 350 for 15-20 minutes. I would add sliced green onions to the top to make it pretty.

meals.title: Spicy Bow Tie Pasta
meals.directions:
1. Make the pasta, any shape will do. I KNOW you know how to do this. You can cook the whole box (up to 454 grams) so you have left overs or invite a friend to make a salad and join you for dinner. You will still have left overs.
2. While the pasta is cooking, take the casing off 3-4 sausages and fry them at medium heat, breaking them up to smaller pieces.
3. Drain the fat off by using a colander set in the sink with very hot water running so you don’t cause a fat clog in the drain. Let the hot water run for a minute once you finish draining the meat to make sure fat is gone from the drain. DO NOT get the sausage wet. All the flavour will go down the drain with the fat if you rinse the sausage itself.
4. Return the sausage to the pan and make sure there are no pink bits.
5. Add the ground tomatoes and the full bunch of parsley, chopped finely.
6. Add herbs and simmer (this means low temperature) for 10 minutes.
7. Last step is to add the cream. Make sure the heat is all the way down so you don’t boil your cream (it will break and get lumpy and nasty).
8. Stir all together and serve.
9. You can sprinkle extra parsley on top and grated cheese if you like. As you know, I like to add red pepper flakes for extra spice.

**NOTE:** You can freeze leftover pasta with the sauce if you don’t get through it in 4 days. It won’t go bad after 4 days (it would take about a week) but it’s freshest (less mushy) in the first 4 days.

meals.title: Stir Fry (Beef & Broccoli)
meals.description: A stir fry with beef and broccoli.
meals.directions:
1. **Prep:** Start cooking white rice first so it's ready when the stir-fry is done. Cover and freeze steak for 30 minutes for easier slicing. Cut broccoli into 6 cups of florets.
2. Combine all stir-fry sauce ingredients in a bowl, stir well to dissolve the sugar, and set aside.
   * 1 tsp fresh ginger grated (loosely packed)
   * 2 tsp garlic grated (from 3 cloves)
   * 1/2 cup hot water
   * 6 Tbsp [low sodium soy sauce](https://amzn.to/31N4CxU) (or GF Tamari)
   * 3 Tbsp packed light brown sugar
   * 1 1/2 Tbsp corn starch
   * 1/4 tsp [black pepper](https://amzn.to/2xd5AWZ)
   * 2 Tbsp [sesame oil](https://amzn.to/2H98YHC)
3. Place a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 Tbsp oil.  Add broccoli florets and sauté 4-5 minutes, partially covered with lid, stirring or tossing several times until broccoli is bright green and crisp-tender then remove from the pan. Tip: If you prefer softer broccoli, add 2 Tbsp water before covering with the lid and it will steam cook the broccoli.
4. Increase heat to high heat and add 1 Tbsp oil. Add beef in a single layer and sauté 2 minutes per side or just until cooked through. Quickly pull out a piece to test for doneness.
5. Add the sauce, reduce heat to medium/low and simmer 3-4 minutes. It will thicken. Add broccoli and stir to combine. Stir in 1-2 Tbsp water to thin the sauce if desired. Serve over white rice.

[Recipe link](https://natashaskitchen.com/beef-and-broccoli).

meals.title: Stir Fry (Chicken)
meals.directions:
1. **To make the chicken stir-fry noodles:** In a large pot with boiling salted water, cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Add the broccoli florets the last 5 minutes of cooking (2-3 minutes for snap peas or green beans) and let them cook with pasta until tender. Drain the noodles and broccoli and set aside.
2. While pasta is cooking, whisk together the brown sugar, soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, ginger, red pepper, and black pepper in a small bowl.
3. Season chicken strips to taste with salt and pepper. Add olive oil to a medium-sized skillet and cook chicken in an even layer over medium heat, turning from time to time for 2 or 3 minutes, until slightly golden. Stir in the garlic, and carrots and cook for a minute more, until cooked through but not overdone.
4. Transfer the cooked spaghetti and broccoli to the skillet and pour the sauce on top and toss until fully incorporated. Reheat for a couple of minutes and serve the chicken stir-fry noodles, garnished with scallion and toasted sesame seeds.
5. Enjoy!

meals.title: Steak
meals.directions:
1. Preheat grill to ~375°.
2. While the grill is heating rub both sides of the steak with about 1/2 a tbsp. of salt and crushed black pepper each, and let sit for ~10-15 minutes.
3. Cook leave over direct heat for ~5 minutes per side (until it feels like the fleshy part under your thumb).
4. Take the steak off the grill, let sit under tinfoil for 5-10 minutes.
5. Plate with steak spice.

meals.title: Prosciutto Wrapped Asparagus
meals.directions:
1. Break the ends off the asparagus and wash them.
2. Wrap the asparagus with the prosciutto (half a slice per asparagus).
3. Place the wrapped asparagus on a baking tray, and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
4. Cook at 400°-425° for 6-7 minutes.
5. Eat!

meals.title: Eating Out
meals.description: Going to a restaurant or something of the sort.
meals.directions:
1. Choose restaurant.
2. Go to restaurant.
3. Eat.
4. Pay.
5. Leave.
